meanings.definition: Comfort or consolation in a time of distress or sadness.
meanings.sent1: After the loss of her pet, she found solatia in spending time with her friends.
meanings.sent2: The soft music provided solatia to the grieving family.
meanings.sent3: The warm cup of tea offered solatia to the cold traveler.
meanings.sent4: Her kind words acted as solatia for his troubled mind.
meanings.sent5: The sight of the sunset brought solatia to her heart.

meanings.definition: Something that provides comfort or relief.
meanings.sent1: A cozy blanket can be a solatia on a chilly night.
meanings.sent2: The old photograph was a solatia for his homesickness.
meanings.sent3: The smell of fresh cookies was a delightful solatia for the children.
meanings.sent4: His favorite book served as a solatia during stressful times.
meanings.sent5: The sound of rain on the roof was a soothing solatia for her worries.
